title: Orthopedics & Joint Replacement in India
intro: India is a preferred destination for orthopedic treatment, offering advanced joint replacement, sports injury care, and spine surgery with faster recovery and excellent outcomes for international patients.

knee.title: Knee Replacement Surgery
knee.description: Knee replacement in India uses advanced implants and robotic assistance to relieve pain, restore mobility, and ensure long-term durability with minimal hospital stay.

hip.title: Hip Replacement Surgery
hip.description: Hip replacement surgeries in India are performed using minimally invasive techniques, enabling quicker rehabilitation and excellent functional outcomes for elderly and young patients alike.

robotic.title: Robotic Joint Replacement
robotic.description: Robotic-assisted joint replacement in India ensures precise implant placement, improved alignment, reduced pain, and faster recovery for knee and hip arthritis patients.

spine.title: Spine Surgery
spine.description: Indian spine centers offer minimally invasive and complex spine surgeries for disc disease, deformities, and nerve compression with advanced imaging and neuro-monitoring.

sports.title: Sports Injury & Arthroscopy
sports.description: Sports medicine in India provides arthroscopic treatment for ligament, cartilage, and shoulder injuries, allowing athletes and active individuals to return to normal activity faster.

q1.question: Why do international patients choose India for joint replacement surgery?
q1.answer: India offers advanced joint replacement surgery using modern implants and robotic technology at affordable costs, with faster recovery and excellent long-term outcomes.

q2.question: What orthopedic surgeries are commonly performed in India?
q2.answer: Common procedures include knee replacement, hip replacement, robotic joint surgery, spine surgery, and arthroscopic treatment for sports injuries.

q3.question: How long is recovery after joint replacement surgery in India?
q3.answer: Most patients begin walking within 1–2 days after surgery and can safely travel back home within 2–3 weeks with proper rehabilitation.

q4.question: Is physiotherapy provided after orthopedic surgery?
q4.answer: Yes. Indian hospitals provide structured physiotherapy and rehabilitation programs to ensure safe recovery and long-term mobility.

q5.question: Does Panacea Medcare assist with post-surgery care?
q5.answer: Yes. Panacea Medcare coordinates physiotherapy, follow-up consultations, and recovery planning even after patients return home.
